image.altText: A Dutch player dribbles the ball as she is challenged by a USA opponent at the Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: The USA and Netherlands finish deadlocked at 1-1 across the Tasman, as Australia prepares to cheer on the Matildas in their next group match against Nigeria this evening. Follow live.

title.children: USA, Netherlands play out tense World Cup draw, Matildas prepare for tonight's match

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It was a dramatic group-stage match, and it has ended in a draw. After all that, the US will be more disappointed not to get the win, as they were so dominant after getting that equaliser. They looked unstoppable once they had their full array of attacking talent going full throttle, so well done to the Dutch for holding out. Still, I think it has shown some chinks in the US armour, as they looked pretty rattled for much of that first half and some of the second. Rose Lavelle, who I maintain is the best player to watch in the world, added the dynamism the US needed in the second half. I expect she'll start for them in the next game.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: USA 1 - 1 Netherlands

children.content: (Getty)
It was a dramatic group-stage match, and it has ended in a draw. After all that, the US will be more disappointed not to get the win, as they were so dominant after getting that equaliser.
They looked unstoppable once they had their full array of attacking talent going full throttle, so well done to the Dutch for holding out.
Still, I think it has shown some chinks in the US armour, as they looked pretty rattled for much of that first half and some of the second.
Rose Lavelle, who I maintain is the best player to watch in the world, added the dynamism the US needed in the second half. I expect she'll start for them in the next game.
(PressBox)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: My prediction is Australia 2 - 0 Nigeria. Goals from Raso and Gorry. You heard it here first.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Predictions time: Who's scoring the goals tonight?

children.content: My prediction is Australia 2 - 0 Nigeria.
Goals from Raso and Gorry.
You heard it here first.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Just as Van de Donk seemed to rile her up, Lindsey Horan does brilliantly from the corner, angling her run to the near post and heading home with power. It's 1-1! Really great header when you see it on replay, diverted with venom into the top corner.

title.children: ASX at five-month high, Fed raises rates as expected, EY staff bullied and overworked

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: As you've been hearing wholesale prices are down 60 per cent on last year amid lower commodity prices and more supply generated by coal, wind and solar. But consumers have faced big price rises on their electricity bills. The Grattan Institute's Alison Reeve told Ros Childs on the ABC News Channel that it will be some time before consumers see an improvement in their bills.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Power prices rise despite fall in wholesale costs

children.content: As you've been hearing wholesale prices are down 60 per cent on last year amid lower commodity prices and more supply generated by coal, wind and solar.
But consumers have faced big price rises on their electricity bills.
The Grattan Institute's Alison Reeve told Ros Childs on the ABC News Channel that it will be some time before consumers see an improvement in their bills.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: EY boss David Larocca has promised to implement the report's 27 recommendations. These include: Revision of key performance indicators to strengthen leadership and recognise contributions to improving diversity, equity and inclusion Increase accountability of staff retention by charging the costs of excessive turnover to service lines Reduce overwork and excessive hours through more accurate project scoping, resourcing and costing EY is also trialing five pilot initiatives including more time in lieu and margin relief to assess partners on revenue measures, but not profit margin. Staff who experienced bullying, racism or sexual harassment over the last five years were less likely to have confidence in making a report or a complaint. "Many people have experienced retribution, particularly loss of access to advancement opportunities, when they have either formally or informally reported harmful experiences," the report found. Women were more likely to experience sexual harassment than men, and people who identified as Indian, Chinese, Maori, Hindu and Muslim were more likely to face racism. The report comes as the big four accounting firms face an existential crisis after Pwc leaked confidential government tax plans to help their multinational clients pay less tax. They face being excluded from lucrative government contracts and there are calls for a royal commission into the consulting industry.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: EY accepts report's 27 recommendations

children.content: EY boss David Larocca has promised to implement the report's 27 recommendations.
These include:
Revision of key performance indicators to strengthen leadership and recognise contributions to improving diversity, equity and inclusion
Increase accountability of staff retention by charging the costs of excessive turnover to service lines
Reduce overwork and excessive hours through more accurate project scoping, resourcing and costing
EY is also trialing five pilot initiatives including more time in lieu and margin relief to assess partners on revenue measures, but not profit margin.
Staff who experienced bullying, racism or sexual harassment over the last five years were less likely to have confidence in making a report or a complaint.
"Many people have experienced retribution, particularly loss of access to advancement opportunities, when they have either formally or informally reported harmful experiences," the report found.
Women were more likely to experience sexual harassment than men, and people who identified as Indian, Chinese, Maori, Hindu and Muslim were more likely to face racism.
The report comes as the big four accounting firms face an existential crisis after Pwc leaked confidential government tax plans to help their multinational clients pay less tax.
They face being excluded from lucrative government contracts and there are calls for a royal commission into the consulting industry.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The EY review was commissioned in September 2022 following the death of auditor Aishwarya Venkat in the firm's Sydney office. More than 4,500 current and former employees were surveyed across Australia and New Zealand. EY says it has already put in place measures to support well being and workplace culture including mental health first aid staff and welfare contact officers. The report found that many of the problems identified are known challenges across professional services firms in Australia, particularly overwork. EY Oceania chief executive David Larocca says the firm has fallen short of the standard that everyone who works at EY has a right to expect. “There are findings in the report that are distressing and completely unacceptable. Bullying, sexual harassment and racism have no place at EY Oceania and I apologise to anyone who has suffered as a result.” " The impact of long working hours is also significant and taking a heavy toll on the well being of many of our people.”
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: EY boss says report findings are 'distressing and completely unacceptable'

children.content: The EY review was commissioned in September 2022 following the death of auditor Aishwarya Venkat in the firm's Sydney office.
More than 4,500 current and former employees were surveyed across Australia and New Zealand.
EY says it has already put in place measures to support well being and workplace culture including mental health first aid staff and welfare contact officers.
The report found that many of the problems identified are known challenges across professional services firms in Australia, particularly overwork.
EY Oceania chief executive David Larocca says the firm has fallen short of the standard that everyone who works at EY has a right to expect.

“There are findings in the report that are distressing and completely unacceptable. Bullying, sexual harassment and racism have no place at EY Oceania and I apologise to anyone who has suffered as a result.”
" The impact of long working hours is also significant and taking a heavy toll on the well being of many of our people.”
